<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/24/pair-storms-threaten-louisiana-oil-gas-production?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Laissez les Mal Temps Rouler
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Storm brewing with oil" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjA0L3N0b3JtX2JyZXdpbmdfd2l0aF9vaWwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After crashing through Caribbean, two major storms are expected to <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/08/23/905231988/louisiana-braces-for-one-two-punch-of-storms-as-marco-and-laura-approach-shore?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit Louisiana</a> within 48 hours of each other. First up is Marco, which made landfall near the mouth of the Mississippi River yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Close behind is Laura, a tropical storm that’s expected to morph into a Category 2 hurricane before thrashing Louisiana in the coming days. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Back-to-back storms are as far on the freak weather event spectrum as fire tornadoes, and their arrival in the middle of a pandemic <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/oil-companies-brace-for-twin-gulf-coast-storms-11598291107?mod=pls_whats_news_us_business_f&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spells trouble</a> for one of the U.S.’ most important oil and gas regions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Gulf is home to almost half of U.S. refining operations. When Hurricane Harvey hit in 2017, about a quarter of the country's refining capacity was paused, sending gas prices soaring. This time around, oil and gas companies shut down roughly 82% of offshore oil production and almost half of natural gas output. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But a price spike hasn’t followed</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. oil benchmark was up <1% Monday afternoon. While Marco and Laura will disrupt production, refiners were already running under capacity as the pandemic cramped demand and excess supplies neared record highs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> It’s revealing that a historic dual-storm event in the Gulf Coast doesn't appear to be enough to muster a rally in gasoline and diesel prices. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Then again, it’s been a topsy turvy year</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The international crude oil benchmark was down last week after major producers said recovery from COVID-19’s suckerpunch has been “<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/red-flags-point-to-faltering-recovery-in-oil-11597925459?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slower than anticipated</a>.”  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two things to blame are rising cases in Europe, which is hurting demand, and OPEC+ producers relaxing this summer's output cuts, which is boosting supplies.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Marco and Laura could do some serious damage in Louisiana. But 2020’s potpourri of unexpected macroeconomic conditions means the impact to supplies and prices should be limited.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F08%2F24%2Fpair-storms-threaten-louisiana-oil-gas-production" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Excess+supplies+and+low+demand+from+the+pandemic+should+cushion+the+storms%E2%80%99+impact+on+the+oil+market+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/24/pair-storms-threaten-louisiana-oil-gas-production&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/24/major-shakeup-dow?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Major Shakeup at the Dow
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Mr. Krabs" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjQxL21yX2tyYWJzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Know Your Meme</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who’s in: </strong>Salesforce, the biotech Amgen, and manufacturing heavyweight Honeywell</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who’s out: </strong>Exxon Mobil, pharma giant Pfizer, and defense company Raytheon</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The 30-stock index best known for being quoted by dads at breakfast tables is getting its <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/24/salesforce-amgen-and-honeywell-added-to-dow-in-major-shakeup-to-the-average.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest makeover</a> in seven years...and it’s all Tim Cook’s fault.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last month, Apple said it would split its stock 4-to-1, which means its influence (and the role of the information technology sector as whole) would be significantly reduced in the Dow’s calculations, which gives companies with higher share prices more weight. The Dow’s overseers believe that weighting wouldn’t accurately reflect the composition of the American economy (which, you know, runs on a lot of tech), so they decided to bring the likes of Salesforce on board. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>This is a big </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-24/dow-industrials-kicks-out-exxon-in-biggest-shakeup-since-2013?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">facepalm moment</a></span><span> for Exxon, which was the world’s biggest company less than a decade ago and has been a proud Dow member for nearly 100 years.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>the changes will go into effect next Monday.</p>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/24/zoom-experiences-outages-disrupts-first-day-school-many-americans?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Zoom Gets the First Day Jitters
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The de facto communication tool of pandemic life experienced <a href="https://apnews.com/40c0db26c763e8fdfa5b5ecc6b15180d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">widespread outages</a> in the U.S. yesterday morning, disrupting remote learning sessions as students across the country logged on to start the new academic year.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The outages spanned both coasts and even some spots overseas. The Atlanta public school system, Penn State, Howard University, and many more institutions </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/education/zoom-outages-disrupt-first-day-of-online-classes-for-many-schools-and-universities/2020/08/24/5caf1494-e61e-11ea-bc79-834454439a44_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were hit</a></span><span>.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">With great bandwidth comes great responsibility</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What was once an enterprise communications platform is now being tasked with helping teach America’s youth. While there are no official figures around how many schools are using Zoom this fall, yesterday's disruption shows the platform is already an integral part of the country's educational infrastructure. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">At the college level: </strong></span><span>In a Morning Brew </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/21/majority-students-say-university-implementing-hybrid-model-fall?email={{profile.email}}&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">survey</a></span><span>, 64% of students said their schools are implementing a hybrid model of both in-person and online learning this fall. 32% are going fully remote.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Zoom was up and running by noon yesterday, but with more schools still to open and competitors galore, the pressure is on to perform.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Vino there are a bunch of delivery services out there these days, but trust us: <a href="https://www.brightcellars.com/?utm_campaign=mbrew082520b&utm_source=mbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=6&n_id=mbrew&a_id=mbrew082520b&d=2&sixbtl=bc" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bright Cellars</a> is made of different grapes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Founded by two wine-crazed MIT grads, Bright Cellars is the <strong style="color:#000">monthly wine club</strong> that uses serious science to match you with <a href="https://www.brightcellars.com/?utm_campaign=mbrew082520b&utm_source=mbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=6&n_id=mbrew&a_id=mbrew082520b&d=2&sixbtl=bc" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wine you’ll love</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You <a href="https://www.brightcellars.com/?utm_campaign=mbrew082520b&utm_source=mbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=6&n_id=mbrew&a_id=mbrew082520b&d=2&sixbtl=bc" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take their palate quiz</a>, creating your own unique <strong style="color:#000">taste profile</strong> in Bright Cellars’ online wine laboratory. Then—in true MIT fashion—Bright Cellars’s <strong style="color:#000">algorithm </strong>takes your taste profile, <strong style="color:#000">picks out</strong> a bunch of wines you’ll love, and <strong style="color:#000">sends those bottles</strong> your way.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But when you <a href="https://www.brightcellars.com/?utm_campaign=mbrew082520b&utm_source=mbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=6&n_id=mbrew&a_id=mbrew082520b&d=2&sixbtl=bc" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sign up for Bright Cellars</a>, you’re not just adding a gaggle of genius wine scientists to your entourage; you’re getting an <strong style="color:#000">all-out wine education</strong>. With wines from all over the world and tasting cards to explain them, you’ll be on your way to wine-scientist status yourself.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
VIDEOGAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/24/video-game-engine-maker-unity-files-go-public?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Start. Your. Videogame Engines.
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Unity, a video game engine maker " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjAzL3VuaXR5X2FfdmlkZW9fZ2FtZV9lbmdpbmVfbWFrZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Unity</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While <em>Fortnite </em>creator Epic Games was going toe-to-toe with a $2.2 trillion Apple over its App Store fees, one of its chief rivals, Unity Software, was gearing up for an IPO. Yesterday, Unity <a href="https://www.thestreet.com/investing/unity-software-platform-for-videogame-creation-files-with-sec-to-go-public?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed to go public</a> on the NYSE. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What does Unity do?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Imagine if Tesla started selling its batteries and software systems to other car manufacturers. Unity does something similar, licensing out its software so game developers can...develop games. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">And boy do a lot of developers use it: </strong></span><span>Unity estimates </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/24/unity-s-1-ipo-filing-drops.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than half</a></span><span> of the 1,000 most popular games on Google’s and Apple’s app marketplaces last year, including </span><span><em>Pokémon Go </em></span><span>and </span><span><em>Call of Duty: Mobile</em></span><span>, were built with its platform. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Epic Games’s version of Unity is called Unreal Engine. If Epic continues to escalate its feud, Apple could disable Epic's developer account, leaving other gamemakers <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/17/apples-battle-with-epic-games-could-affect-hundreds-of-other-games.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unable to use Unreal Engine</a> for iOS and Mac apps. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Unity timed its public filing to perfection.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>If Apple says Unreal Engine has to go, Unity could stand to benefit the most, capturing the engineless developers caught in the Epic crossfire.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here:</strong> Something's in the air, because software startups <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/highly-valued-software-startup-snowflake-files-for-ipo-2020-08-24?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Snowflake</a> and <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-24/asana-files-for-direct-listing-amid-slew-of-software-ipos?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Asana</a> also filed to go public yesterday. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD & BEV
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/24/togo-cocktails-bees-knees-covid19?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Frozen Margaritas
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At least 33 states and Washington, D.C., now allow cocktails to-go because of the pandemic, <a href="https://apnews.com/e2294b0ee850663aa2ea485f0bd943eb?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the AP reports</a>. The number before that? Just two—Florida and Mississippi. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on: </strong>Starting in March, local and state lawmakers relaxed rules on carryout G&Ts to give restaurants and bars a lifeline after they were forced to close indoor seating areas.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Did it work? One survey from May found that 78% of restaurants and bars selling booze to-go brought back laid off employees, higher than the 62% overall rate.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Despite the economic benefit, lawmakers are trying to make sure Main Street doesn’t turn into Bourbon Street. Officials in many areas mandated lids/seals and required that food be purchased with drinks, among other regulations.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead: </strong>Each jurisdiction has its own timeline for when these relaxations sunset...or not. Iowa has extended its to-go cocktail rules permanently, and other states could follow. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/24/morning-pro-soccer-player-eric-dier?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Own the Morning: Pro Soccer Player Eric Dier
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Eric Dier running in a soccer game" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjA1L2VyaWNfZGllci5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Richard Heathcote/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today's Own the Morning participant is English Premier League soccer player and recent app developer Eric Dier. A quick bio for the less soccer-obsessed Brew readers out there: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>He's made 40 appearances for England's national team and is a do-it-all defender for the English Premier League’s Tottenham Hotspur.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>He's developed a location-based food/drink recommendation app with his brother called </span><span><a href="https://apps.apple.com/app/id1464125251?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotlas</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We slid into Eric's DMs to ask him how he owns the morning, what life is like as a professional soccer player, and a little bit about his new app.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3 things you do in the morning that are essential to starting your day off right.</strong></p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Cold shower. I started trying cold showers about a year ago and I can’t imagine having a hot shower anymore. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Making my bed. I had to do it as a kid and now I need to do it to start my day.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mate, a South American drink that I was introduced to by my Argentinian teammates and I have it in the car on the way to training.</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1 thing you do in the morning that other people definitely don’t do: </strong>I don’t think cold showers are very popular in the morning! </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1 thing about your industry no one outside of it understands: </strong>The discipline it requires from a very young age, mainly saying “no” to many things. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1 thing that you are snobby about: </strong>Socks. I’m not proud of it, but if you ask the kit men at Tottenham they will tell you I’m a nightmare when it comes to socks! </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Which is harder: Building an app or playing in the Premier League? </strong>The Premier League is the most competitive football league in the world, but I’m just at the beginning of my journey in tech and I’m sure it’s very competitive too. Building an app is something that was completely out of my comfort zone, so it’s presented challenges that my brother Patrick, Zoe, and I [the founders] are confronting for the first time. Everyone goes to restaurants, bars, and hotels, but before <a href="https://apps.apple.com/app/id1464125251?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotlas</a> there wasn’t an interactive social app custom-built for sharing and discovering recommendations. We’re trying to solve that. </p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nENERGY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nLaissez les Mal Temps 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjA0L3N0b3JtX2JyZXdpbmdfd2l0aF9vaWwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter crashing through Caribbean, two major storms are expected to \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/08/23/905231988/louisiana-braces-for-one-two-punch-of-storms-as-marco-and-laura-approach-shore?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehit Louisiana\u003c/a\u003e within 48 hours of each other. First up is Marco, which made landfall near the mouth of the Mississippi River yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eClose behind is Laura, a tropical storm that’s expected to morph into a Category 2 hurricane before thrashing Louisiana in the coming days. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBack-to-back storms are as far on the freak weather event spectrum as fire tornadoes, and their arrival in the middle of a pandemic \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/oil-companies-brace-for-twin-gulf-coast-storms-11598291107?mod=pls_whats_news_us_business_f\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espells trouble\u003c/a\u003e for one of the U.S.’ most important oil and gas regions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Gulf is home to almost half of U.S. refining operations. When Hurricane Harvey hit in 2017, about a quarter of the country's refining capacity was paused, sending gas prices soaring. This time around, oil and gas companies shut down roughly 82% of offshore oil production and almost half of natural gas output. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut a price spike hasn’t followed\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.S. oil benchmark was up \u003c1% Monday afternoon. While Marco and Laura will disrupt production, refiners were already running under capacity as the pandemic cramped demand and excess supplies neared record highs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e It’s revealing that a historic dual-storm event in the Gulf Coast doesn't appear to be enough to muster a rally in gasoline and diesel prices. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThen again, it’s been a topsy turvy year\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe international crude oil benchmark was down last week after major producers said recovery from COVID-19’s suckerpunch has been “\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/red-flags-point-to-faltering-recovery-in-oil-11597925459?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslower than anticipated\u003c/a\u003e.”  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwo things to blame are rising cases in Europe, which is hurting demand, and OPEC+ producers relaxing this summer's output cuts, which is boosting supplies.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eMarco and Laura could do some serious damage in Louisiana. But 2020’s potpourri of unexpected macroeconomic conditions means the impact to supplies and prices should be limited.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho’s in: \u003c/strong\u003eSalesforce, the biotech Amgen, and manufacturing heavyweight Honeywell\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho’s out: for being quoted by dads at breakfast tables is getting its \u003ca style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest makeover\u003c/a\u003e in seven years...and it’s all Tim Cook’s fault.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast month, Apple said it would split its stock 4-to-1, which means its influence (and the role of the information technology sector as whole) would be significantly reduced in the Dow’s calculations, which gives companies with higher share prices more weight. The Dow’s overseers believe that weighting wouldn’t accurately reflect the composition of the American economy (which, you know, runs on a lot of tech), so they decided to bring the likes of Your. Videogame Engines.\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Unity, a video game engine maker \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjAzL3VuaXR5X2FfdmlkZW9fZ2FtZV9lbmdpbmVfbWFrZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eUnity\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile \u003cem\u003eFortnite \u003c/em\u003ecreator Epic Games was going toe-to-toe with a $2.2 trillion Apple over its App Store fees, one of its chief rivals, Unity Software, was gearing up for an IPO. Yesterday, Unity \u003ca href=\"https://www.thestreet.com/investing/unity-software-platform-for-videogame-creation-files-with-sec-to-go-public?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled to go public\u003c/a\u003e on the NYSE. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat does Unity do?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eImagine if Tesla started selling its batteries and software systems to other car manufacturers. Unity does something similar, licensing out its software so game developers can...develop games. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd boy do a lot of developers use it: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUnity estimates \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/24/unity-s-1-ipo-filing-drops.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than half\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of the 1,000 most popular games on Google’s and Apple’s app marketplaces last year, including \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ePokémon Go \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eand \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eCall of Duty: Mobile\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, were built with its platform. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEpic Games’s version of Unity is called Unreal Engine. If Epic continues to escalate its feud, Apple could disable Epic's developer account, leaving other gamemakers \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/17/apples-battle-with-epic-games-could-affect-hundreds-of-other-games.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunable to use Unreal Engine\u003c/a\u003e for iOS and Mac apps. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eUnity timed its public filing to perfection.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eIf Apple says Unreal Engine has to go, Unity could stand to benefit the most, capturing the engineless developers caught in the Epic crossfire.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here:\u003c/strong\u003e Something's in the air, because software startups \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/highly-valued-software-startup-snowflake-files-for-ipo-2020-08-24?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSnowflake\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-24/asana-files-for-direct-listing-amid-slew-of-software-ipos?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAsana\u003c/a\u003e also filed to go public yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt least 33 states and Washington, D.C., now allow cocktails to-go because of the pandemic, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/e2294b0ee850663aa2ea485f0bd943eb?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe AP reports\u003c/a\u003e. The number before that? Just two—Florida and Mississippi. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on: \u003c/strong\u003eStarting in March, local and state lawmakers relaxed rules on carryout G\u0026Ts to give restaurants and bars a lifeline after they were forced to close indoor seating areas.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDid it work? One survey from May found that 78% of restaurants and bars selling booze to-go brought back laid off employees, higher than the 62% overall rate.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDespite the economic benefit, lawmakers are trying to make sure Main Street doesn’t turn into Bourbon Street. Officials in many areas mandated lids/seals and required that food be purchased with drinks, among other regulations.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead: \u003c/strong\u003eEach jurisdiction has its own timeline for when these relaxations sunset...or not. Iowa has extended its to-go cocktail rules permanently, and other states could follow. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" Dier\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Eric Dier running in a soccer game\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday's Own the Morning participant is English Premier League soccer player and recent app developer Eric Dier. A quick bio for the less soccer-obsessed Brew readers out there: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHe's made 40 appearances for England's national team and is a do-it-all defender for the English Premier League’s Tottenham Hotspur.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHe's developed a location-based food/drink recommendation app with his brother called \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apps.apple.com/app/id1464125251?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSpotlas\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe slid into Eric's DMs to ask him how he owns the morning, what life is like as a professional soccer player, and a little bit about his new app.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3 things you do in the morning that are essential to starting your day off right.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCold shower. I started trying cold showers about a year ago and I can’t imagine having a hot shower anymore. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMaking my bed. I had to do it as a kid and now I need to do it to start my day.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMate, a South American drink that I was introduced to by my Argentinian teammates and I have it in the car on the way to training.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1 thing you do in the morning that other people definitely don’t do: \u003c/strong\u003eI don’t think cold showers are very popular in the morning! \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1 thing about your industry no one outside of it understands: \u003c/strong\u003eThe discipline it requires from a very young age, mainly saying “no” to many things. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1 thing that you are snobby about: \u003c/strong\u003eSocks. I’m not proud of it, but if you ask the kit men at Tottenham they will tell you I’m a nightmare when it comes to socks! \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhich is harder: Building an app or playing in the Premier League? \u003c/strong\u003eThe Premier League is the most competitive football league in the world, but I’m just at the beginning of my journey in tech and I’m sure it’s very competitive too. Building an app is something that was completely out of my comfort zone, so it’s presented challenges that my brother Patrick, Zoe, and I [the founders] are confronting for the first time. Everyone goes to restaurants, bars, and hotels, but before \u003ca href=\"https://apps.apple.com/app/id1464125251?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSpotlas\u003c/a\u003e there wasn’t an interactive social app custom-built for sharing and discovering recommendations. We’re trying to solve that. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F08%2F24%2Fmorning-pro-soccer-player-eric-dier\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
